question: 照らす
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>to illuminate</kanji>. Don't get it confused with <ja>照れる</ja> which is "to feel embarrassed," though, that would be embarrassing. You know this is "to illuminate" because the <ja>らす</ja> is the <reading>rash</reading> (<ja>らす</ja>) you get every time you're illuminated.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Speaking of things that illuminate, your <reading>hand</reading>s (<ja>手</ja>) illuminate all the time for some reason.
